translation: na opak, krzywo, opacznie [not in the intended manner, or out of position, or wrong]
sentence: There are too many people involved, and something is bound to go awry.

translation: oczarować, urzec [to attract or impress someone so much that they cannot think in a sensible way]
sentence: He was completely bewitched by her beauty.

translation: kula [a stick with a piece that fits under the arm, that you lean on for support if you have difficulty in walking because of a foot or leg injury]
sentence: Martin broke his leg and has been on crutches for the past six weeks.

translation: zaniedbanie [(formal or law) the fact of deliberately not doing what you ought to do, especially when it is part of your job; (especially of a building) a state of not being cared for]
sentence: The old railway station was in a state of dereliction.

translation: niepokojący, zatrważający [formal; causing worry and unhappiness]
sentence: The sheer size of their armed forces is a disquieting factor for neighboring countries.

translation: ogrom [the very great size, effect, etc. of something; the fact of something being very serious]
sentence: People are still coming to terms with the enormity of the disaster.

translation: łowisko [an area of water where fish are caught so they can be sold]
sentence: The depletion of fisheries has serious impacts on food security.

translation: migotać [to shine with a light that is sometimes bright and sometimes weak]
sentence: I felt a cold draft and the candle started to flicker.

translation: przeplatać, upoprzekładać [to mix one thing in with another in a way that is not regular]
sentence: Lectures will be interspersed with practical demonstrations.

translation: orzeźwiać [to make someone feel fresher, healthier, and more energetic]
sentence: We were invigorated by our walk.

translation: męczyć, udręczać [to annoy someone, especially by asking them something many times]
zaraza [formal or old-use; any very serious infectious disease that spreads quickly and kills large numbers of people]
sentence: They have flood, pestilence, fire, and earthquake, and governments are another calamity.

translation: bojaźliwy [formal; weak and cowardly; frightened of taking risks]
sentence: He's too pusillanimous to stand up to his opponents.

translation: złościć, irytować [informal; to annoy or make angry]
sentence: Nothing ever seemed to rile him.

translation: apatia, letarg [formal; the state of not being active and having no energy or enthusiasm; the state of reduced activity that some animals experience during the winter]
sentence: In the heat they sank into a state of torpor.
